metadata.title: CVE-2023-52614 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: PM /devfreq: Fix buffer overflow in trans_stat_show Fix buffer overflow intrans_stat_show(). Convert simple snprintf to the more secure scnprintfwith size of PAGE_SIZE. Add condition checking if we are exceedingPAGE_SIZE and exit early from loop. Also add at the end a warning that weexceeded PAGE_SIZE and that stats is disabled. Return -EFBIG in the casewhere we don't have enough space to write the full transition table. Alsodocument in the ABI that this function can return -EFBIG error.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52614` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-200-generic - 5.4.0-200.220~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-200-lowlatency - 5.4.0-200.220~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1135-aws - 5.4.0-1135.145~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1140-azure - 5.4.0-1140.147~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1139-gcp - 5.4.0-1139.148~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1082-ibm - 5.4.0-1082.87~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1134-oracle - 5.4.0-1134.143~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-1119-raspi - 5.4.0-1119.131~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-231.243').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-200.220~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1158.163').
